result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew G. Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Court does not grant Home Monitor.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to 14CM454.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Comply with all conditions in 14CM454.
Court will allow early discharge after 1 year on probation and all the conditions, fines and costs are completed and the agent recommends.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew G. Mitchell in court with attorney John M. Bliss. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both cases heard: 15CM369, 14CM454
11:11 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
 
14CM454 - NO CONTEST
15CM369 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CM454 as a repeater, 15CM369.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Atty Bliss makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CM454 -
60 days jail STAYED
With huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Court does not grant Home Monitor. 
24 months probation
Pay fine of $300 plus costs.  
Maintain fulltime employment, as able. 
Participate in any other counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide DNA sample. 
No contact with B.N.D. or her residence or place of employment while she is occupying the employment place without the consent of B.N.D, her guardian and the agent. 
Not possess any nude photos or sexually explicit photos of B.N.D.  If he does, he is to turn over to his agent. 
Court will allow early discharge after 1 year on probation and all the conditions, fines and costs are completed and the agent recommends. 

15CM369 -
60 days jail, consecutive to 14CM454 STAYED
With huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Court does not grant Home Monitor. 
24 months probation
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Comply with all conditions in 14CM454. 
Court will allow early discharge after 1 year on probation and all the conditions, fines and costs are completed and the agent recommends.

Defendant Matthew G. Mitchell in court with attorney John M. Bliss. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CM454 and 15CM369.

9:30 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.
Atty Knaapen provides the status of the case.
Case to be set for a new Plea Hearing.
Court indicates should put on for a PTC to see if they can come to a resolution.
Court questions Atty Knaapen regarding Plea dates; Atty Knaapen states he is available for a Plea on 11/04/15.
Atty Knaapen indicates 11/09/15 is a Pre-Trial Date; next plea date would not be until 12/08/15 in the afternoon
Atty Bliss would request that the Plea time be set for later in the morning.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant to be in the courtroom at 10:30 a.m.
Atty Bliss to be here by 11:00 a.m.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.
No Contact with B.N.D. or any residence.  Comply with all non-monetary conditions set forth in 14CM454.

Defendant Matthew G. Mitchell in court.  Dave Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
FTR : 1:27:26
Appearances stated on the record.
Warrant is ordered quashed.
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court enters a NG plea

Court understands Attorney Bliss is not able to appear.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 09:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew G. Mitchell
Current: 1200 Huntington Ave, Apt #308, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494 United States  (Effective: 09-01-2015)
Prior: 3717 St Hwy 54 West 11, Nekoosa, WI 54457

Attorney John M. Bliss in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:55 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Bliss is not aware of the reason for non-appearance.
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court.  Asks for body only warrant. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds complaint shows probable cause.  Criminal warrant.  Body Only.
